us.phonetic: /n. ˈprifɪks; v. also priˈfɪks/, (n. prē′fiks; v. prē′fiks, prē fiks′)

example.eg: "Un" is a common prefix in English.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 字首, 词头, 前缀

example.eg: If you prefix this word with "un", it takes on a negative sense.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 给…加前缀, 加前缀于

example.eg: The new system will prefix all existing phone numbers with a three-digit code.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 置于…之前, 加在…之前

us.phonetic: /n. ˈprifɪks; v. also priˈfɪks/, (n. prē′fiks; v. prē′fiks, prē fiks′)

example.eg: George always signs forms using the prefix "Dr."
The medical student already prefixed his name with "Dr."
